Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Menagerie of the Void
boardgame.description:
From the rear cover

Menagerie of the Void is a storytelling game for one player. You play as the keeper of an ancient menagerie, created by a long-gone society and still operating. You create the story as you play, writing down some details, deciding how to care for the exhibits, and drawing cards to see what happens next.

It takes an hour or two to play, using this booklet, a bunch of index cards, and a deck of regular playing cards.

boardgame.name: Pre-Weird Exhibits & Personal Oddities
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Pre-Weird Exhibits

Creating your own strange alien organism is part of the fun, and the game provides you with provocative questions and inspirations. But maybe it's the end of a long work day, and you don't have it in you to imagine some new stuff right now, and you just want to push a few crazy beasts into the game and see what happens.

Backers who invest in a pre-weird option will get twelve unusual organisms pre-weirded, for your use. The organisms include name and description, and they'll be sent by email or Kickstarter message, after the PDF is delivered.

Personal Oddities

These backers get the 12 pre-weird organisms along with six additional bizarre creations, unique to them. That is, I write each group of six exhibits for each backer, not replicated. There might be a few repeating tentacles, but that's the nature of void zoology, I guess.

boardgame.name: Enthusiastic Hireling
boardgame.description:
From the description:

"After 1 day, 2d6 (+1 per 100 sp spent) bright faced folks respond to your advertisment, ready for adventure!"

Includes random tables for names, miens, weapons, and specials.

boardgame.name: Roc of Ages
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A creature for MÖRK BORG inspired by the eagle insignia of the Bundeswehr but intended to be much more frightening.

boardgame.name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Out of this World
Das Streben nach Glück: Nicht von dieser Welt
boardgame.description:
A mini expansion with 60 new, crazy, silly, sci-fi and fantasy themed unique cards that will take your Pursuit of Happiness games out of this world!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Beta Complex
Security Clearance: ULTRAVIOLENT!
boardgame.description:
Security Clearance: ULTRAVIOLENT!
AKA: Beta Complex

Publisher's blurb:

Individuell turnering i spelet där ingen kan vinna. 2nd edition-regler gäller. Förkunskaper är föräderi och bestraffas därefter. Till föranmälda kommer speciella MBD-blanketter att skickas ut. Datorn säger att de gör er lyckligare, och datorn har alltid rätt. Datorn säger också att de som inte medför MBD-papper till turneringen blir olyckliga, vilket är förräderi och bestraffas därefter. Vill du veta vad ett MBD-papper är? Vad är din säkerhetsnivå? Datorn vill att ni skall vara lyckliga. För att kunna vinna måste du vara lycklig och tjäna datorn väI.

User summary:

Prepared as a convention scenario; includes pre-generated characters.

boardgame.name: Little Nemo and the Nightmare Fiends
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




Little Nemo and the Nightmare Fiends is a 2D non-linear platformer with 4 playable characters that players can freely switch between. Each character's unique powers help players explore a huge cartoon world and can be chained for wild amounts of mobility! The game features artwork inspired by the groundbreaking 1905 Little Nemo in Slumberland comic, hand-drawn keyframed animation, and a huge cast of surreal creatures and characters!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Crook
boardgame.description:
Crook is a trick taking game that requires each player to bid on the number of tricks they plan to take during a round of play. The person to the left of the dealer leads out by playing one card of any color and play goes clockwise with each player playing one card per turn. Players must “follow suit” by playing a card of the same color that was led out. If they are out of the color that was led, they can play any color including the trump color. The player that wins the trick takes the cards played (they are set aside to indicate a trick won) and then leads out for the next round of play.

The goal of the game is to score the highest number of points. If a player's bid is made exactly (not under or over) add amount bid plus 5 points. If bid is not made, subtract amount bid or the number of tricks taken – whichever is the greater number. This game is easy to play, but becomes very difficult to accurately predict the number of tricks that will actually be taken. The game ends with a special round where each player is dealt one card and each player shows every other player their card by putting it on their forehead (without looking at it). Bids are made and the cards are laid on the table to see who takes the trick.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Indiepocalypse #4
boardgame.description:
Hello and welcome to Indiepocalypse!

In its simplest terms, Indiepocalypse is just a bundle of games (common thing) packaged with a zine (also common thing) about the aforementioned games and comics, reviews and more!

Each month will feature games by 10 different developers. Each issue I hope to bring together games that explore the breadth of what our art form has to offer.

Also, and this part is very important to me and should truly be taken as given, each contributor is paid and developers are paid royalties on all future sales.

boardgame.name: ANTI-GORGIAS 2
boardgame.description:
A practical guide for game designers in the OSR tradition.

Nothing could be truer. Don't be deceived or taken in by appearances or first impressions or history, this is the Real Deal.

Featuring a guest spot from Ludwig Wittgenstein, good friend of the publication.

boardgame.name: Anti-Sisyphus 1
boardgame.description:
What is Anti-Sisyphus? How the hell should I know? It's a zine, I guess, but its short as hell. Like one sheet of paper folded in half short (hamburger style). I think the kids are calling them "zinis"?

What's in there, anyway? Probably like a couple of mechanisms or small systems for your old school fantasy role-playing game of choice. It's hard to say for sure. There's probably an editorial, as well.

An editorial? In a one-page zine? Yes, I have a writing degree, and I plan to make use of it. I'm sorry for providing such amazing value for your hard-earned dollar.

But like, is it good? Is it useful? Let me be perfectly clear: in no way is Anti-Sisyphus either of those things.

boardgame.name: Anti-Sisyphus 2
boardgame.description:
The World's Least-Impressive RPG Zine Is Back!

This is the second issue of Anti-Sisyphus, an occasional zine with something to do with table games and the way we play them. We promise that its contents are imminently gameable, for some definition of "gameable." This one has an especially (some might say "mercifully") low word-count. It is one page (folded hamburger-style), and it is guaranteed* to delight!


*Not guaranteed.


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ruthless: I Rode with Custer
boardgame.description:
Ever since that fateful day when George Armstrong Custer’s battalion of the Seventh Cavalry met its fate on the Little Bighorn River, men made careers by selling their stories claiming to be the sole survivor.
By the 1950s the last of these men, as well as the Sioux and Cheyenne participants, were in their twilight years.
They all vied for a chance to tell the tallest tale and have their story become a bestselling book which would dominate the United States understanding of the battle.
Was Custer a barbarian -or- a hero of Manifest Destiny?

You must weave your own exciting story of the battle and seek fame and fortune by fighting your way through the most dramatic moments of the Battle of the Little Bighorn!

This mini-campaign is structured in quick “acts” that could be played in a single evening.
Both sides face decisions that allow for a great deal of replay value and let the players write their own story of the Battle of the Little Bighorn….

Players choose their own adventure with one side picking the scenario and the other choosing the set up.
There are a possible 27 different battles that can be played.
The mini-campaign will consist of three of these gunfights.

RUTHLESS, a complete set of western gunfight rules, is also included!
This booklet has everything you need to play!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ai Ai Ai Ai Ai
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ai, Ai, Ai, Ai og Ai er alle kopier af en afdød kvinde, Ai. De er nu maskinintelligenser, der styrer hver sit rumskib. De skal redde resterne af menneskeheden bort fra en ubeboelig Jord.

Men det indebærer blandt andet, at de skal finde sig i hinandens dumheder, i deres kolonisters pylren og frygt, og at de skal komme overens, med de intelligensvæsner, de møder på deres vej ude i rummet.

Slutter menneskehedens historie i en koloni på en fremmed planet eller i et familieskænderi i det tomme rum?

boardgame.name: Hexenjäger I: Vampirjäger
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dusørjægeren Wilhelmina Sparr strøg svovlstikken mod bordets fedtede kant, og tændte sin cigarillos med et dybt hiv. Pustede ud og lod røgen kravle ud under den bredskyggede hat.

“Hey Knytter Kurt! Jeg tror du hellere må pakke regnormen der ned i bukserne og liste hjem til det rottehul du kommer fra!”.

“Hvem helvede i satan er du? Og hvad bilder du dig”, Wilhelmina trykkede på aftrækkeren til armbrøsten, og så med et skævt smil Kurts forbløffede ansigtsudtryk, da pilen spiddede regnormen.

Hun skulle nok sørge for, at han aldrig skulle genere nogen igen. Hun tog knojernet på og rejste sig. Kurt skreg.

Hexenjäger I: Vampirjäger er et lille scenarie om 4 menneskers jagt på hævn over den vampyr der har taget det vigtigste fra dem. Det foregår i Warhammer, men bruger kort og kick ass beskrivelser i stedet for tegninger.

boardgame.name: Blodtågens forbandelse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Benene smerter af at gå på den hårde klippegrund og de flere dages vandring uden mad har gjort dig træt og irritabel på dine rejsefæller. Den sidste kamp var lige ved at koste den tåbelige dværg livet, men han humper stædigt videre mod Stenballe med hans hårdt vundne flaske vin i hånden. Du kigger frem på orken længst fremme, som evigt og altid presser jer fremad, og ønsker at nogen turde skære hans tunge af, så I ikke skulle høre på hans griselyde.

Blodtågens forbandelse er et scenarie om fire straffefanger af hver sin race, som rejser gennem vildmarken for at forhindre en troldmand i at åbne en portal til dæmonernes verden. Der er tale om en blanding af udforskning, rejseoplevelser, listighed og drabelig kampe som kan koste den uforsigtige livet.

Scenariet foregår i et middelalderligt samfund med spredte landsbyer, hvor at legender og sagn fortælles for at overbringe den viden der ellers ville gå tabt. Systemet er Forbidden Lands, som giver dig mulighed for at prøve svenske Fria Ligans nye fantasysetting af.

User summary:

The scenario is published in three PDF files:

27-page overview
17-page instructions
44-page scenario

boardgame.name: Huset for enden af vejen
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

From: GPSinfodanmark@tele.dk
To: Tphoto@gmail.com
Sent on 18 Aug 2019:

Kære Tobias
Jeg ved, at du synes mit job her er fjollet og åndssvagt, men denne gang har vi virkelig ramt jackpotten!
Gørlev Paranormale Sammenslutning er blevet kontaktet af THEODOR BRAMMING (!!!) Jep, den Theodor Bramming, møbelkongen selv. Og han vil gerne have, at vi undersøger hans hus for ‘overnaturlig påvirkning og dårlige energier’. Can you f*cking believe it?!
Det her er ikke sådan helt officielt fra fagforeningens side, men GPS vil gerne frem i verden. Vi vil gerne respekteres blandt danske fagforeninger og være med til overenskomstforhandlinger og alt det gøgl, så jeg fik en idé og jeg har brug for din hjælp.
Vi sender en håndfuld af vores nye og mest lovende clairvoyante til huset for at efterforske, om huset er hjemsøgt eller ej og du tager med, med alle dine kameraer og udstyr. Der er ikke mange penge i det, men tænk nu hvis vi kunne lave det næste Åndernes Magt eller sådan noget? Du ville blive berømt! Og foreningen ville ikke være til grin længere (og måske betale mig mere i løn?).
I tager hen til huset, filmer nogle knagende døre og mystiske lys og bum, så går vi viralt! Jeg har allerede de helt rigtige folk til opgaven og de tror faktisk på alt det der fis; vi mangler kun dig.
Sig nu du vil. Pretty please?

Kærlig hilsen
Julie Hermansen (din yndlingskusine!)
Sekretær, Gørlev Paranormale Sammenslutning.

boardgame.name: Isotoper over Isefjorden
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“Det hele startede med at Ida stjal den syge mands knallert, dagen efter Antons robot stak af ud i skoven…”

Den gang i 80’erne som de kunne have været, er en flok børn på sporet af en mystisk videnskabsmand med skumle planer. Spillet foregår i et alternativt Hornsherred i slutfirserne, hvor videnskaben gik en lidt anden retning. Robotter er et almindeligt syn på markerne og ude på øvelsesterrænet, strømmen kommer fra loopreaktoren på Kyndbyværket og magnetrin-skibe svæver over fjorden med gods. Men skolen er stadigvæk røvsyg, der er langt at cykle hjem til dine venner og forældrene fatter ikke hvad der er så vigtigt ved at få en Nintendo.

Spillet er en smagsprøve på Tales from the Loop rollespillet og ingen forudgående viden er nødvendig om spillet, firserne eller lokalområdet.

For spillere der vil lege med 80er nostalgi, naiv investigation og barnlig action, eller har set for meget Stranger Things.

For spilledere der kan improvisere stemningsfulde detaljer, styre fem spilpersoner gennem en simpel efterforskning og puste liv i firserne ude på landet.

boardgame.name: Klenodiet i kælderen: nuttede venner i livsfare
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Under en fest bryder en lille håndfuld særlige helte ind i Septimus den Skøres kælder for at stjæle et magisk klenodie, som måske kan være en nøgle til at besejre tyrannens uovervindelige galskabs-kræfter. At finde klenodiet og få det i sikkerhed før vagtskiftet kommer til at kræve mod, dygtighed og ikke mindst at de hjælper hinanden.

Spiller: Du har både lyst til at more dig med sjove, skæve spilpersoner og til at blive udfordret af en lille men nasty dungeon. Grundlæggende 5E-kendskab er en fordel.

Spilleder: Du ejer en Player’s Handbook og går ikke i panik, hvis spillere bruger spells på kreative måder — men du behøver ikke være garvet veteran.

boardgame.name: Langs fandens landevej
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bögehafen er på den anden ende. Foran Sigmar Templet bliver der båret ved til heksejægerens bål, mens der lyder skrig fra fangekælderen hvor hedninge bliver afhørt.

En gruppe fæle djævletilberede kaldet Den Røde Hånd er blevet afsløret, og da heksejægeren og hans folk stormede deres tempel, var der mange som døde.

Kultens gedulge gøremål fylder bygen med rygter, og nu har heksejægeren udskrevet arrestordre på Hr. Weiss, en af byens førende rådmænd.

Dusørjægere, lykkeriddere og alle andre med sans for at tjene en god skilling indleder jagten på Hr. Weiss, der dog allerede er langt over stok og sten langs landevejen.

Jagten kan begynde. Kun de mest snu og snilde vil tjene både kirke og klingende mønt.

User summary:

The scenario is publishd as three PDF files:

37-page scenario
19-page pre-generated characters
1-page player handout

boardgame.name: Tørkedal
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Den varmeste sommer i mands minde. Åen er løbet tør for vand. Kvæget er forsvundet. En ældgammel ondskab er vendt tilbage. Fire unge eventyrere kommer på deres livs eventyr, da de involveres i en mystisk sag om forsvundet kvæg.

Tørkeland er et D&D 5th edition scenarie i en verden rig på overtro og trolddom, og hvor fordums myter stadig hænger ved.

Regelkendskab er for spilleren ikke et krav, men det er en fordel. Spilleder forventes at være bekendt med D&D 5th edition reglerne. Scenariet er for en level 1-gruppe.

User summary:

The scenario is published as two PDF files:

21-page scenario
4-page pre-generated characters

boardgame.name: Blazing Beaks
boardgame.description:
Steam description:
Roguelite - where too much greediness can be fatal. A colorful world with armed birds blazing their way through piles of mutants, monsters and creepy creatures. Lots of mysteries to unravel, secrets to discover and levels to explore.

boardgame.name: DemonCrawl
boardgame.description: Steam description: DemonCrawl is a puzzle roguelite that combines the addicting gameplay of Minesweeper with hundreds of unique items, stages, and abilities!

boardgame.name: Rifter
boardgame.description: Steam description - Breathtakingly fast and tough-as-nails, Rifter is an acrobatic platformer drenched in neon and infused with a pumping 80’s synthwave soundtrack. Run, swing, smash and dash at exhilarating speeds on a quest to discover the secrets of a shattered world.

boardgame.name: Tower Climb
TowerClimb
boardgame.description: Steam description - TowerClimb is a difficult and rewarding procedurally generated platformer with roguelike elements. Enormous and mysterious towers of ancient unknown origin stand above humanity, extending to the heavens. Struggle forward as a weak human, driven by an iron will to reach the top.

boardgame.name: Shadow Bug
boardgame.description: Steam description - Leap, slash, splash! You are the overpowered ninja hero Shadow Bug! Save your home forest from the evil factory by slicing monsters to pieces.

boardgame.name: Wenjia
boardgame.description: Steam description - Wenjia is a 2D platform game with puzzle-solving elements. Players can freely travel between two realms (the material world and the energy world), each of them with different challenges and obstacles. Players must utilize both realms’ mechanisms to reach their final goal.

boardgame.name: Nemesis: Lockdown – Untold Stories #3
boardgame.description:
Untold Stories #3 provides a cooperative campaign for Nemesis: Lockdown. They are presented in a graphic-novel/comic-book style, over 60+ full-color pages.


60+ A5 pages
10 dedicated cards
Punch board of special tokens
A lot of additional gameplay.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: What's Your Sign?
boardgame.description:
In What's Your Sign?, players compete to create the most unique and humorous horoscopes for each other. In each round, a "Horoscope" card is drawn, and each player choses an "Ending" card to complete the Horoscope. The winner of each round is decided by a rotating judge. Pro tip: pick your caption card to match the judge’s sense of humor, desires, or sign.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Space Weirdos: A Skirmish Heartbreaker
boardgame.description:
Space Weirdos is a small scale miniatures skirmish rules set balancing simulationist and minimalist game design philosophies to get warbands onto the tabletop and duking it out. Game design is driven by the following considerations:


Low model count: 5-10 models or so for each side.
Use any minis you have.
Short but comprehensive. Everything in one 16 page zine.
Minimal tokens, but still a few because I like them.
No tape measures or rulers, all movement and ranges are measured with 5” sticks.
Uses all your RPG dice (except the d20, d20's get enough love) because dice are fun.
A points system, but you shouldn’t worry about it too much.
Alternating activations, opposed rolls, Command Points, and random tables mean everyone is involved and rolling dice all the time.


The 16 page rulebook includes a FAQ section and a player reference sheet.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: All of Us
boardgame.description:
All of Us is a trivia battle between multigenerational teams of players. The questions are categorized by generation, and teams are free to choose among the various categories: Boomers, Gen X, Millennials, & Gen Z.

Teams alternate answering trivia questions. Only one trivia card is used by each team during their turn, and every player on your team must take a turn. There are 5 questions on each trivia card. The player answering the questions chooses which generation’s trivia they want to answer. The player asking the questions flips over the timer, picks a card, and starts reading the questions aloud.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Der Mord von Kloster Wattenbeek
boardgame.description:
Secluded in the deepest wasteland lies the monastery of Wattenbeek. For hundreds of years it defied the course of history and provided a holy retreat for a small group of nuns. But time does not stop at the venerable convent, and it is hard to find young nuns willing to move into such solitude. There is not even Internet! Despite great protests on the part of the abbess, the convent is now to be sold and for the first time in years there are guests within the sacred walls. The prospective buyers, who have traveled a long way, have their own plans for the monastery, but when the real estate agent Günther Hübsch is found dead in the monastery garden on the second day, the blood freezes in the veins of those present: Because the perpetrator is among them. The police are alerted and the abbess invites all the guests and nuns to the dining room to convict the murderer and then hand him over to the police.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Return of Israel
boardgame.description:
MISSION OF THE GAME
Your task is to take the 12 tribes of Israel out of the slavery of Egypt and lead them with Moses into the Promised Land. During their journey the people of Israel meet many difficulties, which can affect their morale. The task of Moses (the player) is to keep their morale high enough, otherwise traveling will stop. God is with Israel in the pillars of cloud and fire. God helps his people to reach the destination by giving manna from Heaven and water from the rock. Sometimes stubborn people stir up the wrath of God and they have to sacrifice sin offerings in order to reconcile their deeds and get blessings. God rewards the obedience of people by letting them carry the Ark of the Covenant. The winner is the one who reaches the goal and offers first a Sacrifice of Thanksgiving.

The players will advance in pre-determined path in the game by throwing a dice and will have to keep their moral points above 2 by getting maximum of one for free or paying three/five silver coins. The players can also bog each other down by bribing the enemy causing the other to pay to progress or get slowed down. Leading the race after Mount of Sinai is also important, the leader will have the Ark of the Covenant giving him the choice to make additional step.

boardgame.name: Scarlet Citadel - A Dungeon of Secrets
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Once a fortress where wizards honed their eldritch craft, the Scarlet Citadel now holds a sinister reputation — and for good reason. The dungeon’s well-trod stairs have seen few return from their journeys below. Now, malevolent creatures spin shadowy webs, enchant foul magics, and summon forth dark gods. But for those brave enough, ancient treasures and secrets still lie scattered everywhere.

Inside the Scarlet Citadel, you’ll find:

• A classic-style adventure for 10 levels of play, fully compatible with the 5th Edition of the world’s oldest roleplaying game.
• Evocative combats and magical mysteries brimming with plots and subplots.
• Tons of original traps and new monsters, as well as a complete write-up of the nearby town of Redtower, where the adventurers can set up a home base.
• An adventure easily paired with the Scarlet Citadel Map Folio, a fold-out set of playable battle maps from Kobold Press.
• Plus much more!

listing.notes:
This is a brandnew, sealed copy. Latest edition. USA shipping $4.95. Can combine shipping for multiple games.
Outside the Continental USA please send your address for a shipping quote
Payments can be made by paypal: paul@pbmexpressusa.com Make sure you specify the correct shipping address in Paypal, this is the only address I can ship to.
** LOCAL PICKUP ** It is possible to pick up the game locally at: Happy Troll Games 155 N Hwy 27 Clermont, FL 34711 We're right next to the Citrus Tower. https://www.facebook.com/Happy-Troll-Games-1208323879341911/

boardgame.name: Plant Ghosts
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

When the magic of the shadowlands spills out into the lands of the living, the souls of the dead do not rest easy. And when the chaotic magic of mutation is soon after let loose upon that very same ground, life can grow, like a shadow, in the shape of those who pass on. Thus it is with the plant ghosts.

What is to becomes of those creeping vines — the wooden trunks, the leafy boughs — now infused with arcane power? Drunk on the blood of ghosts, even they mock the ways of the living. But which ghosts are their inspiration? In this ruined city, the only people who die are those who came for
treasure, for “adventure.” As their ghosts gnash and wail at the injustice of being murdered in this awful place, the plants that grow here replace their flesh and take up their arms to fight again.

A slain man’s sword, a mauled maiden’s shield, both left lying in the weeds to rust. But now they find their way into flowering hands of bark and green. Like ghosts, they continue a quest to find some worthy treasure. But how can a plant know what gold and gemstones are? How can its mindless
stalks and roots do what human hands cannot?

The plant ghosts do not know what it means to loot a dungeon for treasure, not really. But they do know how to fight, and fight they do. Each time they cut someone down, another one of them rises. How long will it be until the city lives again, full of these abominations?

boardgame.name: San Jenaro Quarterly Game Digest (Volume 8 - Winter 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

REAP WHAT YOU SOW with these eight games about creation and growth from your favourite TTRPG cooperative!

In arbor|culture, let the forest reclaim your city by engaging in urban tree activism.
In Letters of the Sky, play letter-writing vagabonds separated by the post-calamity world; Yet the kind wind still blesses us with both breeze and gale to carry your letters to the other.
In Witchdew Valley, a #witchcrawl game, explore the daily life of a kitchen witch.
In Grind Thumb, you’ll finally get to work on your garden. Are your ready to plant, transplant, and fight the hordes of pests trying to take the fruits (and veggies) of your labor?
And FOUR other AMAZING games!

boardgame.name: TinyZine Compendium 2020
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The 2020 TinyZine Compendium is here!

Containing new heritages, adventures, previews, optional mechanics, and more for a variety of Gallant Knight Games, you'll get material for:

Tiny Frontiers - Revised
Tiny Dungeon: Second Edition
Tiny Supers
Tiny Wastelands
Tiny Pirates
Tiny Living Dead
and more!


This product contains the content of TinyZines #21-#32, released in 2020.

boardgame.name: Wand of Vision
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A recent TV series not give you the ending you wanted? Enjoyed it, but wish it had catered to your favorite fan theory?! Well, worry no more! With the wand of vision, you can put yourself in a pocket reality where everything went the way you would have written it!

Since there’s no telling which multiverse of entertainment you’ll want, we present four versions of this marvelous magic item, one each for 5e, PF1, PF2, and Starfinder!

boardgame.name: Merlin's Lightspace: Starship Actions & Roles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a collection and expansion of the Actions and Roles in starship combat for Starfinder and other space fantasy and space opera games.

It includes

A consolidation of all of the role, actions, and critical effects from across the existing sources.
7 new uncommon tactical roles, each with their own combat related actions.
The expansion of an existing non-role (the passenger).
20 new uncommon tactical combat actions
A comprehensive and easy to use chart listing all of the common roles and actions

boardgame.name: Lost Tomb of the Bitchin' Chimera: Dead Milkmen RPG Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Severed Books is thrilled to announce Lost Tomb of the Bitchin' Chimera, an officially licensed Dead Milkmen roleplaying game module set in the weird world of Tiny Town. Written by Andrew Ervin and illustrated by Justin Sirois, this one-shot adventure blends fantasy and punk into a hilarious story your players will never forget.

A monstrous seabird is terrorizing the hamlet of Tiny Town. The distraught Mistress Brownnose calls for aid. If our adventurers hope to placate the beast, they must cross the Swampland of Desire and find the Life-Is-Shit Boneyard. There, if they’re brave enough—or dumb enough—to enter the lair of the Burrow Owlbear, they might just find the Tomb of the Bitchin’ Chimera.

The adventure is ultimately system-agnostic, and can also be enjoyed using the rules of the world’s greatest roleplaying game. It has been designed for player characters of levels 3 to 5 and you can play it as a stand-alone game or easily fit it into your ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Ignitrix's Hidden Library
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since 2017, I have been an avid contributor to the Star Trek Adventures community, including contributions to Continuing Mission, multiple streamed games, and running the subreddit. Over the years I’ve produced enough homebrew content that warrants updating and combining them all into a book!

Contained within the nearly-200 pages of this book is every single mission compendium, species profile, additional rule(s), setting guides, and other homebrew I’ve written to date. That includes Pandora’s Box, Rig for Red, Hurricane, Andromeda, Deep Space 24, Dark Mirror, The Romulan Star Empire, Tempus Fugit, over eight species profiles, Roll20 macros and guidance, over seven ship profiles, updated Fleet Combat rules, miscellaneous Talents, and more! The content covers nearly every era, as well as the Mirror Universe and Time Travel! The only eras/shows not particularly featured in this book are Picard and Discovery. It’s my understanding that Modiphius is hoping to cover those two in the future, so they won’t be covered here.

boardgame.name: Template: Cosmic Force Infusion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange and wonderful god-like entities exist out there in the Amazing Universe – the embodiments of cosmic forces given form, shape and intellect. And when they act, the galaxy is redefined in the sweep of their hands. But often, the perspective of such beings is so broad and vast that they cannot interact or see reality in the fine detail that mere mortals can. Thus, it becomes necessary that these cosmic forces choose a host, herald or other warrior to carry their will and their agenda forward, infusing the champion with all-mighty power. The Hero or Villain with the Cosmic Force Infusion template has come to be anointed by such a cosmic entity, and with their power comes both godlike might and celestial burdens. This PDF contains everything you need to add this new template inspired from DC Comics Doctor Manhattan and Magog and Marvel Comics Silver Surfer and Firelord to your Superhero genre game store and local home Super-Powered by M&M games.

boardgame.name: Six Spells: Blood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many believe blood magic is solely the purview of necromancers and sorcerers, but these wizards were not the first to use it, and Druids and other nature priests understood for far longer that life comes from death.

This mini-publication contains six blood-oriented spells — Blood Harvest, Blood Spawn, Butcher’s Cure, Cleanse the Water, Death Brings Life, and Egg Sacrifice — compatible with any games using the OGL/d20 system. Many are designed to model the sorts of powers traditionally associated with divine spellcasters who support and protect specific areas or communities.

boardgame.name: Bus: Custom Start Player Marker
boardgame.description:
Show customers the prowess of your bus network in the city with the custom Start Player marker for Bus!

With full color printing on both sides, your bus-line network will be the talk of the town!

boardgame.name: Loading Dock
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 30 x 48 inch Battlemap of an Abandoned Nuclear Reactor , it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“I’ve got enough guns to arm all your henchmen. More importantly, I’ve got special ammo for dealing with heroes; armor piercing for those heavily armored supers, incendiary rounds and more to deal with elemental types, high explosive rounds to deal with those pesky amalgamation or regenerating heroes, and some gyrojet ordinance that spreads out to release a net to capture a sidekick or love interest when you need to lure a hero to their doom. So do we have a deal? ”—Arms Dealer

Loading Dock is a single level exterior map of a small U-shaped dock adjacent to a small warehouse and helipad. A railway extends from the small southwest warehouse to the end of the south side of the dock with a small crane above it to transfer goods from ships to railcars or railcars to ships. A larger crane is at the end of the north side of the dock.

Loading Dock is intended for use in modern, pulp, or superhero games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Bullets, Bills, and Blood: A supervillain and an arms dealer are meeting at the local docks for a secret arms deal. The supervillain has brought assets in the form of cash, precious metals, gems, or other valuables. The arms dealer has brought assault rifles with specialized ammunition magazines. The supervillain and arms dealer are both looking out for the double cross and have brought their henchmen and goons to the meeting. The supervillain and arms dealer have escape contingencies by sea via boat and by air via helicopter.

The group is playing as superheroes who find out about the meeting from local law enforcement who are hesitant to go up against the supervillain, a disgruntled henchman of the supervillain, etc. The superheroes must prevent the supervillain from getting those guns to arm their minions. The potential double cross means that the superheroes might be stepping into a crossfire and three-way fight!

boardgame.name: Generator Room
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Generator Room. It has Hex, Square and No Overlays; it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Art is a magic of creation. It is the only way to banish spirits created by such destruction.”—Sodality of Murals Shaman

Generator Room is a single level interior map of a decrepit power generator and storage room in the ground floor of a factory or a warehouse. This map features rusted walkways and concrete debris on the floor making it perfect for an abandoned or post-apocalyptic building.

Generator Room is intended for use in modern, superhero, or post-apocalyptic games. In a modern game, it can be a generator room on the ground floor of an old factory with poor safety conditions. Constantly running machines above on the second floor have shaken parts of the ceiling causing concrete shards to collapse onto the ground floor. An earthquake could completely collapse the factory floor above. In a superhero game, this could be the power room of a supervillain’s lair in an abandoned factory or as the power source linchpin of their master plan. In a post-apocalyptic game, this could be a relatively well-preserved generator room with rusted walkways showing its age and the piles of debris from holes in the above ceiling with water falling through the cracks in the ceiling.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

The Sodality of Murals: A group of spelunkers found a cave with a generator room. Only one of them survived to climb out of there to tell the tale. The room was infested with blast shades, unfortunate souls whose bodies were disintegrated in nuclear blasts leaving only a shadow on walls. Their spirits remain in the world of the living and they feed on electricity and other forms of power, even the electrical currents of living beings. The survivor explains that the others were fried when they were touched by the shades leaving charred husks.

The group is tasked to escort a Sodality of Murals art shaman to the generator room. His magical paints can harm and banish blast shades. The risk is great but electricity is a scarce resource worth claiming...

boardgame.name: Victorian Transit Center
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Victorian Transit Center. It has Hex, Square and No Overlays; it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“This is the letter. Does the writing style or ink hold any clues, inspector?”—Dover Station Director

Victorian Transit Center is a single level exterior map of a northern railway, northwest merchant shop and railroad ticket office, northeast harbormaster and airship ticket offices, eastern sea and docks with a loading and unloading crane, southwest carriage ticket office, inn/tavern, warehouse and stables, and southeast airship landing pad. Transportation in or out of the map is provided by horseback, carriage, train, ship, or blimp. Or by your feet if you are broke!

Victorian Transit Center includes a reprint of the steampunk ship from Above Decks PWYW.

Victorian Transit Center is intended for use in modern or steampunk games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Bomb Threat at Dover Station!: Dover Station has received a letter threatening that the station will be destroyed at high noon. The group is playing detectives or inspectors sent to investigate Dover Station and try to prevent the bombing. With only a few hours left till noon, they are given the letter and carte blanche to investigate the station.

boardgame.name: SWORDPOINT: A Swashbuckling Roleplaying Zine
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

SWORDPOINT is a dynamic, fast-paced and cinematic roleplaying game designed to evoke the classic swashbuckling novels and films of yester-year!

Featuring a revised OGL d100 system, the focus of the game is on dramatic, quick, and easy to use resolution that is easy to hack, modify and make your own at the tabletop.

boardgame.name: The Morningstar Sails Again
boardgame.description:
You are the crew of The Morningstar, the most feared pirate ship in the Seventh Sea. You are on an adventure to recover your recently deceased captain’s buried treasure using his collection of maps. Unfortunately, he didn’t label any of them.

Using randomly generated maps, you and your crew will venture across the seas to find the buried treasure, fighting through other pirates, the magistrates that would arrest you, and monsters of the depths on your way.

A one page RPG using the Sunrise Scouts system, all you need to play is a handful of d6s and a GM to play!

boardgame.name: Anomalous
boardgame.description:
In Anomalous, 2-4 players control researchers on an isolated space station at the edge of a wormhole, trying to complete their mission to study the other side while coping with their emotions and relationships with the other researchers on the station. Players will study the alien artifacts that come out of the wormhole and roleplay scenes with each other as they - and the space station - slowly break down.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Super Elite Dino Force
boardgame.description:
A one-shot RPG system wherein you can pretend to be 80’s style action heroes; who happen to also be dinosaurs.

Feedback always welcome!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Nickelodeon Blue's Clues Find The Clues, Matching Board Game
boardgame.description:
INSPIRED BY BLUE’S CLUES AND YOU!: This game is based off the hit kid’s TV program Blue’s Clues and You! Look for clues around the house just like Blue does in the show! Blue’s 3 clues will lead you to a solution.

FAST-PACED MATCHING GAME: Blue will give you 3 clues. To find them, look quickly through the house and on the board. If you can find the third clue quickest, you’re the winner of that round!
GREAT LEARNING TOOL: Matching games help kids with color and object recognition.

QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Just take out the game components, read the easy-to-follow instructions and you're all set. For 2-4 players, ages 3 and up.

Spin Master offers a variety of board games & puzzles for kids & adults. Classic, card, family, trivia, party games & more. Puzzle lines feature characters for kids of all ages, adult jigsaw, 3-D & more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Gem Rummy
boardgame.description:
Gem Rummy is similar to standard Gin Rummy except each card has a background color & gem symbol; Kings have two background colors; (Jokers are included but are not used in hands). Adding colors to each card allows for more interesting combinations (like having all eight gems in hand). Another difference is that (2) 6-sided dice are used at the beginning of each hand to establish the "Knock number", and also the "Diamond number" for a special meld called "Queen's Diamonds".

The object is to get your hand down to a few points of Deadwood by getting Melds.

There are 3 phases to each hand: 1) DEAL & ROLL; 2) CARD PLAY; 3) SHOWDOWN & SCORING.
Cards in Melds and Lay-offs will not score for your opponent, but have no inherent point values themselves. Cards not in Melds or Lay-offs are called Deadwood and might add points to your opponent’s score.

There are 4 different Melds available: Sets, Runs, Stashes, and Queen’s Diamonds (the latter two are new).

SET: At least 3 cards of the same rank (i.e., 5, 5, 5).
RUN: At least 3 consecutive cards in the same suit (i.e., 6, 7, 8, all clubs).
STASH: At least 4 cards of the same gem color (i.e., 4 Emeralds).
QUEEN’S DIAMONDS: Any Queen + one designated Diamond card that is determined by the initial roll number on the dice. Both dice are rolled to find one number (i.e., 3 and 4 = 7, indicating 7 of Diamonds is the card). An “11” or “12” indicates JACK of DIAMONDS.


Also, "Gem Parts" is a bonus players can earn by having all 8 gems at the end of a hand.

A new minimum score rule keeps the game moving along nicely.

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
Brand new deck in shrink wrap (54 cards). Comes with 2d6 (24mm) and 2 pages of rules, all in a small drawstring bag.
I use SQUARE payment services and I can invoice you through that, in addition to other payment options.

boardgame.name: They Came From Outer Space!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Keep Watching the Skies!

These Archetypes, Tropes, and other details merely scratch the surface of what you can do with an Outer Space! game. If you maintain the era and setting as laid out in They Came from Beneath the Sea!, you need change very little to make this supplement work for your group.

We look forward to seeing your Astronuts and Survivors fighting side by side, all while the Eccentric and Mouth get to argue over who gets to declare “the end of the world is nigh!”
boardgame.rpg: They Came From Beneath the Sea!

boardgame.name: Addams Family: A Delightfully Frightful Creepy Board Game
boardgame.description:
Two to Seven ghouls compete in a race around the Addams family mansion to finish tasks (collect tokens) so they can enter the path to the swamp and arrive there first!

Along the way fellow family members may try to trick you into helping them via possession, push you backwards when they land on your space, have a roll-off with someone to win tokens... or perhaps the mansion itself may try to trap you. Visit the cemetery, the haunted tree and more grotesque locations on your quest!

boardgame.name: Winter Court: Shiro Kyotei
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A One-Round Low/Mid-Rank INTERACTIVE Adventure for Living Rokugan (Champions of the Emerald Empire)

The Emperor has ordered representatives from all the Clans to meet Shiro Kyotei this winter to settle their differences. Who can refuse the dictates of the Son of Heaven?

User summary:

The scenario is published as three PDF Files:

6-page outline

Best Left Buried is a fantasy horror game where the monsters are scary and the players are scared. Within the Crypt, these adventurers will be beset by strange monsters, bizarre environments and eldritch magics, which will take them on their journey from fresh faced recruits to grizzled survivors.

To that end, this Zine provides 4 sections of further dangers, complications and consequences to your Cryptdiggers’ adventures.

Best Left Buried is a fantasy horror game where the monsters are scary and the players are scared. Within the Crypt, these adventurers will be beset by strange monsters, bizarre environments and eldritch magics, which will take them on their journey from fresh faced recruits to grizzled survivors.

Best Left Buried is, usually, about scrounging for advantages while conquering places humanity was not meant to go, at dreadful cost to one’s own body and mind.  If this low power level isn’t to everyone’s tastes, or if players wish to begin play as experienced adventurers, follow the processes listed in this supplement.

There are things that dwell in the Crypt, and some are Best Left Buried

boardgame.name: The Atlas of Dead Stars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Atlas of Dead Stars is a cartographic supplement for Necronautilus by World Champ Game Co. and other weird science-fantasy space games. It comes with 3 hex grid maps in trippy space colors and a blank hex grid on A4 sized pages that can be printed and pasted together to make a large map. Full size versions of the maps on A3 pages are also provided. The atlas also contains 3 pages of images of strange planets that can be cut out and stuck to the maps during play as the Death Agents explore the galaxy of death. (Blank sticker paper makes this extra convenient.) The evocative images of the planets provide inspiration when choosing Words to generate the details of each planet in play.

boardgame.name: 0 hp
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This slim 4 page supplement for "old school" adventure games helps you add dramatic death scenes and injuries to your games with bland "hit points". Are you tired of being at negative hit points and having nothing to do but "roll to stabilize" or begging other players to heal you or just rolling up a new character while the others continue to play?

Maybe you'll miraculously pull through with scars and an eyepatch. Maybe you'll spit out a curse (that actually means something) on your enemies with your dying breath or bequeath your allies a blessing that aids them in their quest as they carry on without you. Or maybe you'll just go out in a blaze of glory that passes into legend!

boardgame.name: Blood River
boardgame.description:

Blood River is a micro map hex crawl adventure that can be played with your favorite system. It's a small and simple campaign and pairs well with a small and simple game system like "3 BONES" or Highland Paranormal Society's "Prole" or "Tunnel Goons". There are three pages: one to give to the players and two that can be printed double-sided for the GM's use.

boardgame.name: Anyday Funnies
boardgame.description:
In Anyday Funnies, you are a cartoonist rushing to draw a comic strip before you hit your deadline.

Each player gets one play sheet to draw on. 1st player rolls three dice. If you roll a pair or a trio, only you get a bonus.

Starting with the player who rolled, select 1 number from
the dice & draw/write what is on the chart below.

After all players have drawn, X out one deadline clock. The game ends when all clocks are x’d out. Use the scoring chart to determine score.

All players show each other their comic (you get a bonus if you make someone laugh!) The player with the highest point total wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Battle of the Hexes
boardgame.description:
In Battle of the Hexes, players will take part in a war of spell cards. They play as mages with a set of spells they choose from, who do battle to the death. There are different types of magic as well as different types of spells; and the player must carefully select their strategy and spells to defeat their opponent.

Players must each build a hand of 15 cards, by drawing by turn from a draft of cards. These cards can then be played on different lanes, damaging only what is in their path unless stated otherwise on the card. If no other card is in their respective lane, damage from the cards goes directly to the opposing player’s health. Once a player loses all their health, they lose the game.

General Gameplay:

Gameplay occurs over several stages. Players keep track of whose turn it is through the turn indicator card. They must simply flip it when their turn ends.

Draw Stage:

During the draw stage: All cards sets should be shuffled first. Determine a starting player, that player is dealt the “Destruction Spells” set of cards. Then they will choose one to keep for their hand, and pass the rest of the cards to the opposing player, who will then choose one of their own, and return it to the starting player again. That process should repeat itself until each player has a maximum of 5 cards of that particular set. Any remaining cards should be placed aside for later use in the game. Afterwards, that same process is repeated with the “Summoning Spells” set of cards, followed by the “Alteration Spells” set of cards.

Play Stage:

This stage is where players play the cards they have chosen during the Draw Stage. The starting player from the previous stage starts here. During this stage, players get to use their 6 stamina points to play cards they have in their hand. Each card requires a certain amount of stamina points to be played. Any unused stamina points at the end of this stage cannot be used as extra in the next round. For the first round only: once the player has played all the cards they want, it is then the opposing player’s turn to play their cards in the same manner. Each card type must be placed in the correct area of the battlefield sheet according to their respective type symbols. “Destruction” and “Alteration” cards must remain face down until the Battle Stage starts. Players may stack up as many of these cards in one lane as they want, but only one “Summoning” card is allowed in one lane at a time. Players may draw cards from any of the draw decks at any time during this stage, but it will cost them 1 stamina point.

Battle Stage:

During this stage, the player who played their cards last gets to attack first. The players’ cards will deal damage to the opposing player’s cards only on their respective lanes unless stated - otherwise on the card - and according to their damage points on the card. Damage is done to both sides simultaneously. Cards that belong to the same spell class deal only half damage to each other. Any card that loses all its HP points must be discarded. All discarded cards are returned to their respective draw deck, placed at the bottom of each. If the opposing player’s lane is empty, then damage would go directly to that player’s own HP. Players keep track of how much damage each card is dealt through the red health pieces. One red health piece means the card lost one HP, and so on. Players keep track of their own health through the counters.

Following this stage it is back to the play stage for the opposing player. Whenever players run out of cards, each draw deck is taken and reshuffled, and the players draft cards between each other in another Draw Stage.

boardgame.name: Black Flag
boardgame.description:
Black Flag is a nautical theme game, in the game you can choose your role, recruit crew, transport goods, and expand the fleet to dominate the Caribbean.

Cards:

Character card
Pirate: Each time you recruit a crew member, you can get one extra person.
Businessman: Each trade will get an extra 5 gold.
Governor: Can station one or more ships in the port, When a ship is stationed, all income from transactions in the port is attributed to you.

Ship card
Heavy cruiser: 30HP 3DMG 3RNG 1SPD
Light destroyer 20HP 3DMG 1RNG 3SPD
20G/Ship
10G to repair well

Goods Card
Wood 1G Land-Island 3G
Sugar 1G Island-Land 3G
Drapery 2G Land-Island 7G
Rum 1G/5bucket (Each crew member consumes one piece per round)

Ship Equipment Card
Speed card: +1 SPD
Shield card: +3 HP
Cannon card: +2 DMG
3G/card

Crew Card
2G/crew
Used for ship-to-board warfare

How To Play
Choose a ship as your lead ship (Fleet speed depends on the speed of the leader ship)
Initially you will get 100G
Choose your own birth port
In your turn you can choose to move, buy goods, buy/repair ship and attack other players' fleets.

Combat system
Sea War: Cannon attack between fleets, If the HP of the ship is to zero, it will be sunk.
Ship-to-board warfare: Close to the enemy fleet, you can board the enemy ship for close combat. Offset the crew, and the more people win.

How To Win
I.Destroy other players
II.Businessman can earn 1500G to win
III.The governor can occupy 8 ports and win

boardgame.name: Star Adventure: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
You board an aircraft with a team of adventurers to perform many trips through the cities of Celestia and recover their wonderful treasures. Your journey will not be safe, but you will attempt to be the richest adventurer by collecting the most stars.

However, in this new game, the captain will draw a card from the pink deck, which is the question deck, basically cards with assumptions of the player, such as "I like pineapples on my pizza". The other players need to guess if it’s a yes or a no.

The players who get it right will be able to get stars from the next island. The players who get it wrong will NOT get stars from the next island.

The captain then draws 1 card from the dark red deck: the deck of destruction. An empty dark red card means that the ship will not face any natural disaster.
Everyone will draw 1 card from the green deck: the escape card.
The captain will then reveal his cards of destruction. They will then try to escape from these natural disasters. The captain will go first.

The first one to get 30 stars will win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Isvaffelspil
boardgame.description: The game consists of 10 pastel-coloured dice and 50 cards representing ice cream cones with one to five scoops. Each player receives 5 dice and a half of the cards, face down. Both players turn the first card from their deck at the same time and then roll the dice. They save the dice matching the scoops on their card, and may reroll any of the other dice as many times as needed to complete their ice creams. The player that first completes their ice cream wins both cards, and a new round starts. When the piles are exhausted, the game ends. The player with the most cards wins.

boardgame.name: Finding Sasquatch
boardgame.description:
We set out to build a game that truly captures the legend of Sasquatch. There have been more than 10,000 reported sightings of Sasquatch in the US alone, yet no one has successfully proven or disproven their existence. In Finding Sasquatch, you'll find elements of the legend of Sasquatch - mystery, deception, fact-finding, adventure, and a little right-place-at-the-right-time. We hope this game can bring some mystery and excitement to your game nights, and maybe even create some believers.

What makes Finding Sasquatch unique?

Gameplay depth: There are unique strategy elements around determining how and where to find Sasquatch and players must be strategic about how they influence Sasquatch's location, what information they share with other players, and what information they keep for themselves.

Caters to broad audience: The game has multiple layers of strategy and complexity, making it great for everyone from newbies to hardcore gamers. Play it for family game night, with your gaming group, or just 1 on 1 with your bestie.

Beautiful artwork and high quality cards: To fully capture the Sasquatch theme we focused on getting the artwork, graphic design, and physical features just right. Gameplay aside, we think you'll be pleased with the quality of the product.

—description from the publisher

1-page battle "cert"
Nine 1-page "favor"
Three 1-page "enmity"


This scenario also is referred to as Battle or Battle Diplomacy - as the primary activity of the interactive scenario most likely involves a large combat event.

boardgame.name: The Coral Tournament
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Isawa Akiko speaks first: “The Phoenix are pleased to join the Crane in welcoming you to Toshi no Omoidoso, the City of Remembrance, for the first Coral Tournament. This tournaments is being sponsored by our Clan and the Crane specifically to celebrate peace and cooperation within the Empire. I am Isawa Akiko, Mistress of the Void. The Elemental Council could conceive of no greater way to demonstrate our dedication to the ideal of peace than to have one of our own serve as judge over the Taryu-jiai tournaments. This honor has fallen upon my simple person. I look forward to the glorious demonstrations of control and mastery that await. But, it is rude of me not to have introduced my companion. This is Daidoji Ogai, Master of the Kakita Dueling Academy.”
boardgame.rpgseries: Heroes of Rokugan: Champions of the Sapphire Throne
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

boardgame.name: Winter Court: Toshi Ranbo
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Toturi Dynasty: The Chancellor has organized this Winter Court in an apparent effort to force the Clans to recognize one of the Toturi children as the legitimate heir to the throne. Apparently, he believes that if all the Clans throw their weight behind one of the children, the previous revelations about the Empress’ infidelities can be ignored for the good of the dynasty. Whether his scheme can succeed remains to be seen.
boardgame.rpgseries: Heroes of Rokugan: Champions of the Sapphire Throne
boardgame.rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (3rd Edition)

boardgame.name: Retirement
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“The blade of hatred has found a new master, and he shall ravage all before him. He is the hunter and we are all his prey. None shall stand against him, for Honor has become as nothing, and those who defend the truth are become corrupt, weak and vile and contemptible. The heavens will bleed, and the Dragons themselves will bow their necks before his power. All shall fall into ruin, the Great Wall will burn, and the black ships will ravage the sacred city. Only Honor can change fate, but Honor is dying, a corpse whose stench poisons the heavens themselves.”

User summary:

This scenario also uses the series code ST-INT AUS.

boardgame.name: The Voice of the Emperor
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A One-Round All-Ranks EXCLUSIVE Adventure for Heroes of Rokugan (Champions of the Sapphire Throne)

The Emperor’s twin sons are dead. The PCs have witnessed those deaths in person, and as a result, they will be invited to accompany the Emperor and his late sons back to the Imperial Capital for their funeral. During this journey, the PCs will have the opportunity for private conversation with the Son of Heaven – a rare and special privilege. They will also have the chance to deal with a threat to the Emperor’s most trusted advisor, the Imperial Herald, Miya Shikan.

boardgame.name: Words Cut Like Steel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A One-Round Special Exclusive Adventure for Heroes of Rokugan (Champions of the Sapphire Throne)

This adventure is part of the climactic story of Heroes of Rokugan. The Steel Lion, Akodo Gintaku, has seized control of the Imperial capital, imprisoned the princess Toturi Yukihime, and proclaimed himself as Emperor of Rokugan. He is supported not only by the remaining armies of the Lion Clan but also by a vast Shadowlands army which he has bound to his own service by means of the unnatural sacrifice of the Jade Dragon.
